title: WATCH: TikTok Chick Eats Pounds Of Butter Every Day, Says It Helps Her Avoid Panic Attacks ​
description:
This TikTok gal eats pounds of butter and oil everyday. Which is much better than the TikTok gym bro who ate wet cat food for the gainz. That video is forever burned into my retinas.

Twenty-four-year-old Manon Alias Onboou of France has gotten millions of TikTok views by showing her fans just how much fat she consumes on a daily basis. Onboou actually said she's recovering from an eating disorder, and that eating copious amounts of fat helps her ward off panic attacks: “I started eating butter and chocolate together whenever my eating disorders got worse, because I would simply empty my pantry otherwise."

In one video, she showed her fans a haul of four days-worth of groceries and unloaded 18 packages of butter and four bottles of oil. If this really is just for four days, that means she eats 4.5 packages of butter and a bottle of oil per day. The comments of her TikTok reflected the shock of her viewers, with many asking why she eats so much butter. There are also many comments wishing her well and offering her support in her recovery.


@onbooudespates


She said that the super sweet combo helps her avoid binging, and she wants to share her diet online to feel less alone as she recovers from her eating disorder: "Although many people suffer from this, I used to hide myself and feel ashamed, as well as guilty. For those who don’t suffer, it allows them to see the living hell some people go through and possibly be more aware of pathological behaviors they could notice from their friends. I like showing the reality that the path to recovery is not linear – it doesn’t go from everything to nothing.”

I wish Onboou well in her recovery. It seems that when people recover from eating disorders, they often go through periods of disordered eating habits other than restriction before they begin to eat normally again - so perhaps that's what she's going through now. I hope she will soon get to a healthier place physically and mentally, and hopefully adopt a more typical diet. With just a tad less butter.

>

<

Lily is a Zoomer college dropout who somehow landed a writing gig here at LwC.com. In her spare time, she enjoys going for runs, touching grass, and occasionally tweeting tweets for fellow tweeters.

title: WATCH: Joy Behar Goes On Bizarre Rant, Claims Gen Z Is Leftist Because Republicans Cause Tornadoes
description:
Joy Behar has some intriguing thoughts about Republicans, and we are very glad she shared them today on The View. The (unintentional) entertainment value of that show is unmatched.

The ladies were discussing a poll that found 77% of Gen Z'ers backed Democrats for Congress. Which, as a fellow Zoomer myself, hurts my heart. We gotta step it up, gang.

But Behar had some interesting opinions as to why the youngest voting generation chose Democrats - guns, abortion, and...tornadoes. Yes, tornadoes.

\u201cJoy Behar declares "this is the end of the Republican Party" and they're NEVER "going to win elections anymore in this country."\nShe claims the GOP is going back to 1897.\nShe blames the GOP for school shootings and tornados.\u201d
— Nicholas Fondacaro (@Nicholas Fondacaro) 1680793955

Behar also claimed this is the end of the Republican Party and Republicans will never win any elections any more. Which may be true. But not for the reasons she thinks. ANYway...

"These kids were born in 1997, not 1897, which is where the Republican Party is going. And they're like hey, wait, hold up. I don't want to get killed in school. I don't want to be, you know, in the middle of another tornado or whatever the hell is going on in this country. All I hear about are tornadoes all the time."

Uhh...what.

Behar seemed to quickly realize her claim made no sense. But she already said it on live television, so she had to go full steam ahead with pinning natural disasters on the Republican Party. So she asked her fellow panelists if the recent tornadoes are due to climate change, and they all reassured her that yes, they are. Definitely. In fact, I heard Josh Hawley is personally brewing up another whopper of a storm as we speak. Just to be that way.

She then claimed young women want their abortion "rights," just in case. Just in case they do that thing that leads to a baby, and end up creating a baby. Gotta have that "murder" option on the back burner.

And unfortunately, this claim might actually be true. Abortion seems to be a sacred "right" for many women in this country. Not so sure about the tornadoes, though.

>

<

title: "This isn't about what's best for America": Crowder exposes what these woke companies are really up to
description:
Crowder closed out this week with a mega segment centered on the latest company to sponsor Dylan Mulvaney - Nike. Yes, if you haven't heard, Nike is paying Dylan to model women's leggings and sports bras. Despite the fact that Dylan lacks the body part that necessitates a sports bra. This is normal now.

Crowder set the scene by highlighting Bud Light's sponsorship of Mulvaney - specifically Kid Rock and Travis Tritt's reactions to the move, and how the majority of Americans agree with them. They don't like it. Crowder then explained how, now, patriotic Americans can support small, local businesses that produce alcohol instead of these mega woke corporations.

Crowder then brought up several more examples of companies that have gone woke and, subsequently, gone broke: Disney, Amazon, and the NFL. All of these companies lost massive amounts of money after embarking on woke missions. Crowder explained that they actually don't care, however, because they're "writing for the writer's room," not the actual customers. This brought him to the topic of ESG scores.

"You have these companies that are simply looking at this as a game [...] Think of Hollywood, these movies suck, but they're looking to open the market in China, they're looking to open markets elsewhere. And so this isn't about what's best for America at this point."

Crowder then brought it back to the point of supporting local communities over the global community, which is essentially globalism. Companies are willing to sustain short-term losses to shape the world in the way they think it should run, abiding by the rules of wokeism. This will, they believe, line their pockets in the long-term by creating a market that shares none of our patriotic values.

The full episode has so much more on this topic - plus, Elon Musk slapping NPR with a "state-run media" label, and the founder of CashApp getting fatally stabbed in San Francisco. So catch the whole show exclusively on Rumble.


>

<

title: Watch: Doorbell camera catches deliveryman's perfect, unfiltered response to an Anti-Biden doormat
description:
Doorbell cameras are an endless source of quality entertainment. Our favorites are the ones where porch pirates don't realize the amazon box was rigged with explosives. Every so often, you catch someone in the act of the highest form of patriotism: dissent. A delivery man was dropping a box off when he reacted to an anti-Biden doormat. His response is so perfect, it looked like the homeowner started a TikTok account just to share the video. In under two days, it's already over 300,000 views.

Tweets embed better. Plus, unlike the commies who work at Twitter, TikTok is owned by Communist China.

#FJB
🤣🤣🤣🤣 Love this guy! pic.twitter.com/JszZ6JyFzl
— Outlaw Bonnie Parker (@OutlawBParker) August 4, 2022

"F*ck Joe Biden."

"Damn right!"

"F*cking prick."

It's remarkable the diverse group of people who dislike Joe Biden. Whether it's Times Square tourists who say he's f*cking up America or people on the beach in Miami who think he's a "ho," they really hate Ol' Puddinghead.

"F*ck Joe Biden" is, of course, a reference to the popular "F*ck Joe Biden" chants that have broken out at live events. The first recorded incident was at a Coastal Carolina game in September of 2021. However, there are some who place the first "F*ck Joe Biden" chant at a Brantley Gilbert concert the month prior. Whoever started it, sports fans will no doubt be continuing in when college football returns in a few weeks.

Whoever this deliveryman is, congratulations. Without even knowing it, you have been awarded a 10/10 for content. Please stay hydrated becaause it's a scorcher out there today. Also, f*ck Joe Biden.

>

<

title: Our competent FBI..raided a pilot's hotel room and detained him for nearly an hour before realizing they made a mistake
description:
Don't you just love the FBI? It's wonderful we can rely on highly-trained, extremely competent agents to serve and protect us. By detaining innocent civilians during simulations. Amazing work.

This past Tuesday, federal agents were participating in a training exercise at a Boston hotel. The exercise was designed to simulate situations that Department of Defense personnel might encounter during a deployment. The agents reportedly busted into a room on the 15th floor of the Revere Hotel and detained the hotel guest. Who was not the simulation player.

The FBI said in a statement, "Based on inaccurate information, they were mistakenly sent to the wrong room and detained an individual, not the intended role player." Woopsies!

\u201cOops! The FBI burst into the wrong hotel room in the middle of the night and interrogated a stunned individual during a training exercise...\u201d
— Bianca Nobilo (@Bianca Nobilo) 1680772806


\u201cThis was one hell of a wake-up call\nhttps://t.co/xlohF8OfQx\u201d
— Daily Caller (@Daily Caller) 1680752400

The innocent detainee was a Delta Airlines pilot. The poor guy was catching up on his zzz's when the FBI unceremoniously burst into his room. The agents then handcuffed him and placed him in the shower before interrogating him for 45 minutes. Yes, it took them nearly an hour before they figured out they had the wrong dude.

But, according to the FBI, "thankfully, nobody was injured." The pilot may just be psychologically damaged for life. But that's fine.

The Boston Police were then called to the hotel, and they confirmed it was a training exercise gone awry. But don't worry, folks. Though this may sound terrifying, the FBI reiterated that "safety" is ALWAYS their main priority: "Safety is always a priority of the FBI, and our law enforcement partners, and we take these incidents very seriously. The Boston Division is reviewing the incident with DOD for further action as deemed appropriate."

Thank heavens we have such a competent federal agency at our disposal to protect us from criminals. Like innocent airline pilots sleeping in their beds. What would we do without them.

>

<

title: Man steals school bus, brings home dead deer, and runs naked from cops. Umm, we have questions.
description:
As far as local news stories go, this is definitely one of the most bizarre I've ever encountered. So of course we have to cover it here at Louder with Crowder dot com.

A Pennsylvania man named Tony Saunders stole a school bus on Tuesday. Which is strange enough as it is. Why would anyone steal a school bus? They're quite difficult to drive and, as far as stolen vehicles go, they might just be the least inconspicuous option. I'm not in any way advocating criminal activity. But if you're going to steal a vehicle, why go with the bright yellow, 20,000 pound one? Rookie mistake.

\u201cPennsylvania man gets naked and steals a school bus to haul his dead deer home https://t.co/4JIRAlCBb7\u201d
— Not the Bee (@Not the Bee) 1680729415

Anyway, police chased Saunders in the school bus across three counties. At one point during the chase, Saunders drove over a berm and nearly flipped the bus. So it got pretty intense.

Saunders eventually parked the bus on a neighborhood street, got out, and began running. As he ran, he stripped off his clothing until he was butt-naked. (I'm telling you now. This detail is never explained. We just have to accept his nakedness.)

He continued to run through parking lots and busy areas until police caught up with him and arrested him. Still fully-naked. Saunders then admitted to stealing the bus after he crashed a BMW.

But wait, there's more: Saunders told police there was a dead deer inside the bus. He was trying to bring it home to fertilize his garden. As one does.

He is currently being held at the York County Prison for fleeing an officer, receiving stolen property, reckless driving, and resisting arrest.

Pennsylvanians, what's going on in your state? I've been there many times and never saw anything this wild. But I must say, I do hope Saunders's garden survives his stint in jail. He risked a lot for those plants.

>

<

Lily is a Zoomer college dropout who somehow landed a writing gig here at LwC.com. In her spare time, she enjoys going for runs, touching grass, and occasionally tweeting tweets for fellow tweeters.

title: Woke bakery removes the cross from popular Easter pastry and we have a guess as to why
description:
A bakery in Brisbane, Australia decided to remove a somewhat crucial part of Hot Cross Buns - the cross. It also renamed them "Easter time buns," due to the lack of a cross.

It's not entirely clear why the cross has been removed, but we have a solid guess. The cross is probably too offensive to modern society's woke sensibilities. Even though it's the entire point of Easter, it seems some would rather focus on a life-size rabbit that breaks into your home in the middle of the night and hides eggs for your children. (Side note: can we talk about how terrifying this concept is? Even as a child, I was like, "come again?")

\u201cBakery slammed for 'woke madness' after it removed a major feature of hot cross buns and gave them a new name https://t.co/2VdiAIwEo5\u201d
— Daily Mail Online (@Daily Mail Online) 1680764238

Michael Sherlock, co-founder and former CEO of the Brumby's Bakeries franchise, spotted the reimagined Hot Cross Buns at a local bakery, and told Courier Mail it was "woke madness": "This is just another case of woke madness removing the name hot cross buns. This wouldn't have happened in my time at Brumby's. You can't have Easter without hot cross buns. They've been synonymous with Easter celebrations since the 12th century in England."

Hot Cross Buns are traditionally eaten on Good Friday to mark the end of Lent. They are little buns filled with spices and dried fruit (usually raisins or currants) and topped with a "cross" of frosting. I've made them before, and they're...not great, in my opinion. I much prefer cinnamon rolls. But that may be due to my childish tastebuds.

It's baffling but unfortunately not surprising that even just the symbol of the cross is now deemed too offensive for Easter. Even though the cross is absolutely central to Easter. At least people are still calling out this madness instead of just accepting it as the "new normal". That fact alone gives me hope that we can come back from all the woke, anti-Christian insanity.

>

<

Lily is a Zoomer college dropout who somehow landed a writing gig here at LwC.com. In her spare time, she enjoys going for runs, touching grass, and occasionally tweeting tweets for fellow tweeters.

title: "Shut the f*** up, b****": Comedian compares CNN to a nagging girlfriend in the perfect analogy
description:
After a week of CNN's non-stop coverage of the Trump indictment, the one that revealed thirty-four charges of derp, I wanted to bring back this Donnell Rawlings classic. The comedian compared CNN's breathless anti-Trump coverage to a nagging girlfriend. A more fitting analogy one can not conjure up.

It's from three years ago and was about the early stages of the pandemic. As you watch, consider how much worse the news-based content provider has gotten since then.

Donnell Rawlings comparing CNN to a nagging ex-girlfriend is the perfect way to describe their Trump Indictment coverage. pic.twitter.com/oO92NdXal2
— Louder with Crowder Dot Com (@LWCnewswire) April 6, 2023

"CNN is like a nagging girlfriend. It's like, "Oh, b*tch, shut the f*ck up. The same sh!t, b*tch? ... You ain't got nothing else to argue about? Five years ago, you haven't found another argument? CNN will be like, "You remember that time?" ...If you listen to too much CNN, you don't even know what the f*ck is going on with nothing other than how much you hate this motherf*cker."

CNN wants Trump politically because they know he can be beaten in a general election. DeSantis does better with independent voters and doesn't fall into media traps as easily.

But more than want Trump, CNN NEEEEEEEEDS Trump. They need Trump to do Trump things so that they can repeat those Trump things. Then analyze those Trump things. Then squeeze eleventy people onto a soundstage to have them discuss those Trump things. Without Trump, what would they do? Report news? That's crazy talk.

CNN is worse than the nagging girlfriend. They're the nagging girlfriend who thinks they can change you. Then when you have had enough, won't calm down crying "PLEASSSSSSSE DON'T LEAVE MEEEEEEEEE!"

>

<

title: Watch: Anti-Trump actor Michael Rapaport picks a fight with a girl Antifa agent and we're not sure who to cheer for
description:
Anti-Trump tweeter and former (?) actor Michael Rapaport was taking in the sights and the sounds of the Trump Indictment on Tuesday. You know, the one that caused a media circus so that Alvin Bragg could declare thirty-four counts of NOTHING. Prior to the indictment being unsealed, it allowed Rapaport to show off his anti-Trumpedness on Twitter. He was happy.

Until he got into it with a girl agent from ANTIFA.

“You wanna walk around the corner with me?”

Actor Michael Rapaport challenged #Antifa members to a fight outside the Manhattan courthouse yesterday ahead of Trump’s arraignment. pic.twitter.com/Ttvq5gujjg
— Andy Ngô 🏳️🌈 (@MrAndyNgo) April 5, 2023

Rapaport vs. Antifa. My man's reaction here is all of us.

Unclear is what started the incident. All we hear is Rapaort bowing up to Antifa Annie. "Don't make the mistake" was repeated multiple times. Also, "I don't know where the f*ck you think you are." "Do you wanna walk around the corner with me?," was also repeated ad nauseam. It was believed to be a challenge to a fistfight. Though someone in the crowd implied Rapaport was looking for oral sex.

Here's where things get confusing. We said in the headline Rapaport picked a fight with a girl. Rapaport kept saying "my man." Antifa being afraid to show their faces can make things confusing, and no one here at the Louder with Crowder Dot Com website wants to ever misgender anyone ever.

But this dude looks like a chick to us.

His silly political opinions notwithstanding, outside of the underrated Beautiful Girls (1996), I've never cared much for Rapaport. The actor can occasionally get things right. Then when he is about to put two and two together and realize the left is the cause of most of this country's problems, he remembers he's an actor and complains about Trump or Doocy or something something Fox News.

Rapaport vs Antifa in a slap fight would have been dope, though. On behalf of We the Content, we encourage someone to throw a punch next time.

>

<

title: Watch: Nike hires influencer not born with breasts to model women's sports bras
description:
Yeah, I've got nothing.

Dylan is now the brand ambassador for Nike 🤡🌎 pic.twitter.com/YyoCehMtbO
— Clown World ™ 🤡 (@ClownWorld_) April 5, 2023

Nike has hired Dylan Mulvaney, someone not born with breasts, to sell women's sports bras. For you see, girls love shopping and cute fitness gear. And since Dylan has been a girl for over a year, Dylan is the perfect influencer to sell fitness gear to women.

It's not shocking that Nike would sacrifice itself at the altar of wokeness. The company has been normalizing the bulge when they bend over and take it from Communist China for decades.

I guess this new front that's been opened up in the culture wars has me feeling a certain way about two things.

One, I go back to a more innocent time, pre-White House visit, where I legit thought Dylan Mulvaney was a parody. If I were a guy who wanted to pretend to be trans for social media clout, I'd talk about how awesome it is to shop and wear makeup and how that defines me as a "girl." Dylan acts like how people who don't like women act when they impersonate vapid basic bitches. I don't buy sports bras because, much like Dylan, I was not born with breasts. Maybe insulting and ridiculing and making a mockery of women is an effective way to sell them couture. I'm sure Nike has tons of market research on the topic.

Two, I hear the criticism from readers about "why are you effectively advertising for these companies" by writing about this. I get that. The Bud Light thing was more for the freakshow content aspect of it. Plus no one was sure if it was an April Fool's prank or not. But this Nike thing reeks of a cheap publicity stunt where they are relying on right-wing outrage for free promotion. So they get none.

Instead, since Dylan is a real girl who is getting into fitness as real girls do, I think she needs to expand her content. Let's see Dylan film her workouts at the gym, catch dudes checking her out, and gym shame them for it. May the deity or deities of content, in their divine wisdom, make it so.

>

<

Brodigan is Grand Poobah of this here website and when he isn't writing words about things enjoys day drinking, pro-wrestling, and country music. You can find him on the Twitter too.
